title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 503.2 - Hearings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 503.2 - Hearings

State Regulations
(a) The presiding officer may direct that a hearing be held in any
proceeding. (b) Hearings may be
conducted solely on documentary evidence, or held at a location selected by the
presiding officer. Written notice setting forth the return date for paper
submissions, or the date, time, and location of the hearing will be mailed or
sent electronically to all parties of record. (c) If mailed, notice will be mailed via
first-class mail prior to the date of the hearing. (d) Any notice not returned by the post
office for nondelivery, or electronic notification of failed delivery, shall be
presumed received by the respondent. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
